page.title: 04WHITES COTTAGE
page.content: WHITES COTTAGE WAS ORIGINALLY CALLED WEBBS LANE COTTAGES, WHITES LANE,BEENHAM. THE NAME WAS CHANGED IN THE 1950'S.THE BARN IS DATED 1415-1430 AND IS BUILT FROM OLD SHIPS' TIMBERS. IT IS ONE OF THE FEW EXAMPLES OF CRUX BARNS IN BERKS.IT WAS MODERNISED IN 1955.THE HOUSE IS ALSO DATED 1415-1430 BUILT WITH SHIPS' TIMBERS. THE TWO CHAMBERS ON THE SOUTHERN END HAD NO UPPER FLOORS. THE THIRD CHAMBER WAS BUILT WITH AN UPPER FLOOR TO PROVIDE BETTER ACCOMODATION. THE BUILDING HAS BEEN LIVED IN CONTINUOUSLY. IT WAS BOUGHT FROM BEENHAM ESTATE IN 1939 IN A VERY RUN DOWN CONDITION.THE COTTAGE HAS BEEN RETHATCHED AND SHOULD LAST FOR 30 YRS. THE PRESENT OWNER IS MRS. ALLISON WHO ALONG WITH HER HUSBAND HAS GIVEN A GREAT DEAL OF HER TIME TO VILLAGE AFFAIRS.(CHAIRMAN OF SCH. GOVERNORS FOR OVER 20 YRS.
